articles.author: Jennifer A. Kingson
articles.title: Voice biomarker tech analyzes your voice for signs of depression
articles.description: Software that analyzes snippets of your speech to identify mental health problems is rapidly making its way into call centers, medical clinics and telehealth platforms.The idea is to detect illnesses that might otherwise go untreated.Why it
articles.content: Software that analyzes snippets of your speech to identify mental health problems is rapidly making its way into call centers, medical clinics and telehealth platforms.The idea is to detect [+5056 chars]
articles.summary: Yes, but: Skepticism and ethical questions surround voice biomarker tech, which observers describe as promising but not foolproof  and ripe for potential misuse.For example: Amazon's Halo wearable has drawn heat for its vocal tone tracking feature, which uses a form of voice biomarker technology. The bottom line: The zeal of Big Pharma, insurance and health care companies will likely propel voice biomarker tech forward, and its early detection powers could prove helpful in diagnosing myriad conditions  if the related efficacy and privacy concerns are kept in check.  but not what you say.
articles.html_summary:
• Yes, but: Skepticism and ethical questions surround voice biomarker tech, which observers describe as promising but not foolproof — and ripe for potential misuse.For example: Amazon's Halo wearable has drawn heat for its vocal tone tracking feature, which uses a form of voice biomarker technology.
  • The bottom line: The zeal of Big Pharma, insurance and health care companies will likely propel voice biomarker tech forward, and its early detection powers could prove helpful in diagnosing myriad conditions — if the related efficacy and privacy concerns are kept in check.

articles.author: Mike Butcher
articles.title: Survey finds 67% of European women in tech feel underpaid compared to men, half experience sexism  TechCrunch
articles.description: A survey found that overthe last 12 months, almost 67 percent of women feel they are paid unfairly compared to their male counterparts. In 2019 46.4 percent of respondents thought themselves to be paid fairly, while in 2022 this figure fell to 33.1 percent.
articles.content: Last month, on International Equal Pay Day, the International Labour (ILO) Organization revealed that on average, women globally are paid about 20 percent less than men. This pay gap is even bigger f [+2315 chars]
articles.summary: Only 24 percent of respondents said the gender ratio in the industry was becoming more balanced in the last 12 months compared to 42 percent three years ago. Not exactly good news, then.In 2019, just 44 percent of those surveyed said they felt pressure to prove their worth when compared with their male counterparts.Regarding the gender ratio in the technology industry, this appears to be going moving in reverse. The survey follows a report by European Women in VC, that saw all-female startups secure just 2 percent of all funding in 2021, down from 3 percent in 2020. That said, the majority (70.4 percent) were aged between 25 and 44, and over 78 percent of respondents were from Europe. Last month, on International Equal Pay Day, the International Labour (ILO) Organization revealed that on average, women globally are paid about 20 percent less than men. This pay gap is even bigger for Black and Hispanic women, where Black women were found to earn over 63% less than white men, and Hispanic or Latina women 57.3% less. Perhaps further surveys could delve into this.The survey, distributed via email to the Web Summit Women in Tech community, received 340 responses, so technically it is not what would normally constitute a scientific polling.
articles.html_summary:
• Only 24 percent of respondents said the gender ratio in the industry was becoming more balanced in the last 12 months compared to 42 percent three years ago.
  • Not exactly good news, then.In 2019, just 44 percent of those surveyed said they felt pressure to prove their worth when compared with their male counterparts.Regarding the gender ratio in the technology industry, this appears to be going moving in reverse.
  • The survey follows a report by European Women in VC, that saw all-female startups secure just 2 percent of all funding in 2021, down from 3 percent in 2020.
  • That said, the majority (70.4 percent) were aged between 25 and 44, and over 78 percent of respondents were from Europe.
  • Last month, on International Equal Pay Day, the International Labour (ILO) Organization revealed that on average, women globally are paid about 20 percent less than men.
  • This pay gap is even bigger for Black and Hispanic women, where Black women were found to earn over 63% less than white men, and Hispanic or Latina women 57.3% less.

articles.title: Nokia sees improved 3Q profit, sales on strong demand for 5G
articles.description: Wireless and fixednetwork equipment maker Nokia has reported substantially improved thirdquarter profits and higher sales on the back of strong demand for 5G technology from operators. The company based in Espoo, Finland, on Thursday reported net profit of
articles.content: HELSINKI (AP) Wireless and fixednetwork equipment maker Nokia reported substantially improved thirdquarter profits and higher sales Thursday on the back of strong demand for 5G technology from oper [+2943 chars]
articles.summary: Net income attributable to shareholders was up 21% at 550 million euros from 454 million euros a year earlier.
articles.html_summary: • Net income attributable to shareholders was up 21% at 550 million euros from 454 million euros a year earlier.

articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.title: GlobalFair secures new cash to simplify procuring construction materials
articles.description: GlobalFair, a startup developing a platform to simplify the process of procuring construction materials, has raised $20M in equity and debt.
articles.content: The construction materials market is fragmented, according to GlobalFair CEO Shaily Garg, because it involves layers of both supply chain and logistics complexities. In a 2021 survey for the National [+5098 chars]
articles.summary: While the platforms flagship product is a marketplace that connects contractors, distributors, fabricators, architects and construction companies to procure materials, GlobalFair also offers a tool to automate construction material cost estimates from architectural plans and site shop drawings. Across the world, global supply chain challenges are resulting in construction delays and labor shortages.Garg says she developed an interest in construction at an early age. It brings the companys total raised to $22 million following a $2 million seed round last February.The idea of GlobalFair was something Chandra and I felt strongly about, given the fragmented nature of construction businesses, Garg said. Garg says that GlobalFairs clientele runs the gamut from big manufacturers and local distributors, to exporters, to retail chains buying from distributors.Garg attributes the companys recent success in part to the pandemic and the subsequent supply chain chaos. In H1 2022, alone, funding in the sector totaled $1.3 billion, according to Pitchbook  up 44% from H2 2021.COVID-19 has had a seismic impact on global production networks, such that logistics costs and existing supply chains have altered fundamentally, Garg said. The construction materials market is fragmented, according to GlobalFair CEO Shaily Garg, because it involves layers of both supply chain and logistics complexities. By using technology to stitch together a network of manufacturing facilities across India and South East Asia, GlobalFair enables buyers in any country to discover new supply in an efficient, transparent and secure electronic market.
articles.html_summary:
• While the platform’s flagship product is a marketplace that connects contractors, distributors, fabricators, architects and construction companies to procure materials, GlobalFair also offers a tool to automate construction material cost estimates from architectural plans and site shop drawings.
  • “Across the world, global supply chain challenges are resulting in construction delays and labor shortages.”Garg says she developed an interest in construction at an early age.
  • It brings the company’s total raised to $22 million following a $2 million seed round last February.“The idea of GlobalFair was something Chandra and I felt strongly about, given the fragmented nature of construction businesses,” Garg said.
  • Garg says that GlobalFair’s clientele runs the gamut from big manufacturers and local distributors, to exporters, to retail chains buying from distributors.Garg attributes the company’s recent success in part to the pandemic and the subsequent supply chain chaos.
  • In H1 2022, alone, funding in the sector totaled $1.3 billion, according to Pitchbook — up 44% from H2 2021.“COVID-19 has had a seismic impact on global production networks, such that logistics costs and existing supply chains have altered fundamentally,” Garg said.
  • The construction materials market is fragmented, according to GlobalFair CEO Shaily Garg, because it involves layers of both supply chain and logistics complexities.
